title.narrative: SUR 1.3 POSITIVE PRACTICES AND NORMS

description.narrative: Increased capacity of rights holders and duty bearers to foster positive practices and norms to protect children from violence, abuse, exploitation and neglect, which contributes to Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, national legislation is implemented to prevent, mitigate and address violence and other childhood abuses and the justice, education, public health, security and other sectors observe children's rights to this protection.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Increased capacity of rights holders and duty bearers to foster positive practices and norms to protect children from violence,abuse, exploitation and neglect

description.narrative: ;Capacity strengthening of social workers and development of strong family policy with the pillars of parenting, support and guidance of parents and care givers are necessary to establish strong families, with a child friendly environment in the community, without violence. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:23/01/2022

title.narrative: Proportion of children aged 2 to 14 (1 to 14) years who experience violent disciplinary practices by an adult member of the household(47613), Text

actual.value: 2019:The past period the office supported generation of (qualitative) evidence to have a better understanding of the issue of VAC, raise awareness and get high level commitment to address the persisting issue of VAC. To continued effort to strengthen the child
